ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Weapon Advice
ygData.msgSnippet: I m able to download the 1/4/01 version with data file dated 2/13 without any problems from that page...  Worked fine. Slyde ... From: Nygaardr, FC3
ygData.messageBody:
I'm able to download the 1/4/01 version with data file dated 2/13 without
any problems from that page... Worked fine.

Slyde

-----Original Message-----
From: Nygaardr, FC3 [mailto:nygaardr@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 02, 2001 8:18 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Weapon Advice


The web page says no new downloads. Anyone have a version they could send
me? If so thanks.

Mu

-----Original Message-----
From: Mike Finger [mailto:mike_finger@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 02, 2001 2:00 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Weapon Advice


Copeland's Weapon Analyzer can be found at::
http://www.geocities.com/copelandeq/weaponanalyzer.html

Very nice tool.

Notebender
Bard of the 28th note
Veeshan
----- Original Message -----
From: Blitz Krieg <blitz_krieg@...>
To: <eqbards@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, August 01, 2001 7:27 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Weapon Advice


> In a comparison for an offhand weapon, you're right, ratio is more
important than speed. Strictly for your offhand, the Saber will be better
than the Partisan. But, I think the Partisan might be fast enough to be
better than the 14/24 Mace in your main hand. If it is, then you're
comparing the Mace and the Saber for the offhand and the Mace wins out
easily.
>
> Copelands is a program that'll calculate how much damage weapons will
produce over time. Hopefully someone knows where to find it, because I
don't remember where I downloaded it. :/
>
> If you can find it, I'd compare the Partisan and the Mace and see which
will put out more damage. If the Partisan wins, then go with Partisan in
main and Mace in secondary. If the Mace wins, go with Mace in main and
Saber in secondary.
>
> Darkfox
>
> BTW, I moved to Rubi'Ka 2 as Kiod if you're looking for me over in AO. :)
>
>
> Why the Partisan over the Saber -
> Saber 11/23 = .478
> Partisan 9/19 = .474
>
> Is it the speed of 19 over the 23? I thought ratio was more important
than
> speed?
>
> Also - what is Copelands?
>
> Thanks buddy
>
> Slyde
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Blitz Krieg [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, July 31, 2001 6:28 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Weapon Advice
>
>
> If you're committed to using the Mace and Saber combo, I'd put the Mace
in
> primary. Normally you want the fastest weapon in the main hand to take
> advantage of the primary hand damage bonus, but in this case I believe
the
> better ratio of the mace will make it superior to the saber. If I were
you,
> tho, I'd use the Partisan in main and the Mace in offhand... I believe
> that'll give you a higher damage output overall (19 Delay fast weapon in
> primary and great ratio weapon in secondary). Reserve the Saber for
> situations where you don't want aggro.
>
> You may want to verify my recommendations on Copelands just to be sure,
> hehe.
>
> There is a proc message, but for the life of me I can't remember what it
is
> atm.
>
> Darkfox
>
> I have the following:
> Guardians Mace 1HB 14/24 Proc: Guard (24 or so Cleric AC Buff)
> Symphonic Saber 1HS 11/23 CHA+10 Int+5 Symphonic Harmony
>
> Which should go in the primary and which in secondary? The Mace has a
> better Ratio - but I thought someone posted faster weap should be in
> primary. Also - the mace procs CONSTANTLY.
>
> Anyone know if there's a message for the proc on the Saber? I just
got it
> and haven't been able to tell.
>
> Lastly - I was previously using the Guardians in primary and a
Sioniches
> Partisan (Piercing 9/19 Cha+6 Int+2 Sv Magic+5) in my offhand - and
don't
> see any reason to hang on to it. Any Xegony guys know what's worth
and
> anyone who may want to buy it?
>
> Slyde Katzenjammer
> 56 Bard Xegony
> Officer, Dragons of Kel`Dar
>
>
